meanings.definition: Sticky or greasy dirt or residue.
meanings.sent1: After fixing the car, his hands were covered in gunk.
meanings.sent2: The kitchen sink was full of gunk after a big dinner party.
meanings.sent3: She tried to clean the gunk off her shoes but only made it worse.
meanings.sent4: The old pipes were clogged with gunk, causing a leak.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic used a special solvent to dissolve the gunk in the engine.

meanings.definition: To become clogged or coated with gunk.
meanings.sent1: If you don't clean the filter regularly, it will gunk up.
meanings.sent2: The drain started to gunk after years of use.
meanings.sent3: The gears in the clock seemed to gunk together, making it stop ticking.
meanings.sent4: The paintbrush gunked with dried paint, making it unusable.
meanings.sent5: The machine gunked up with dust, causing it to malfunction.
